Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Typical sequence for an order RO CA RI PI QC PO GSL D IC RP

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Starting with equivalence this means if the first activity occurs it has the same occurrences as the second one But in this scenario I dont see any activities that would have the same number of occurrences Maybe there are no equivalences here leave equivalence as an empty set for now

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: always_before if the first activity occurs then the second should have been executed previously So pair RI CA PI RI QC PI PO QC GSL PO D GSL IC D RP IC Also CA RO and chain

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: the constraint is only direct not necessarily transitive so include direct dependencies between consecutive activities

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: always_after if the first occurs then the second is executed in one of the following events So RO CA CA RI RI PI PI QC QC PO PO GSL GSL D D IC IC RP reversed pairs

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: never_together the two activities cannot co-exist in the same case But all activities are part of the same process so they all occur in the same case no never_together empty set

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: activ_freq each activity occurs exactly once per order So for all activities the allowed frequency is 1

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: directly_follows if the first activity occurs then the second occurs immediately after consecutive pairs RO CA CA RI RI PI PI QC QC PO PO GSL GSL D D IC IC RP

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: equivalence since all activities occur exactly once any pair would satisfy equivalence but that would be redundant and not useful so equivalence empty set

Name: Validation - PE
Text: lets check if all constraints make sense This seems correct
